meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's your boy, back with another groovy review for ya!

I'm here to dish out the dope on Watch Dogs, the open-world action game that's all about hacking and car chases (because who doesn't love a good ol' fashioned high-speed pursuit?!). Now, I know what you're thinking - "Self-deprecating reviewer" alert! But fear not, young players, for this review is all about funnin' it up while still keepin' it real.

So, let's get this party started with some quotes from the critics. IGN says Watch Dogs is "fundamentally very well made" and has plenty of unique ideas to make it a great game (84/100). GameSpot agrees, calling it "lushly produced" and "riotous" with an ability to keep you hooked (80/100). Meanwhile, Game Informer gives props for the hacking abilities that add a fresh twist to the gameplay (85/100).

Now, I'm no expert, but even I can tell that these critics are onto something! But don't just take my word for it - or theirs. Let's dive into what makes Watch Dogs so rad.

The first thing that popped out at me was how much fun I had playing as Aiden Pierce, the game's protagonist (and self-proclaimed vigilante). With his trusty smartphone and some serious hacking skills, you can literally hack your way through Chicago's streets. It's like having your own personal superpower! And, let me tell you, it never gets old.

Of course, there are plenty of other things to do besides hacking (though, let's be real, that's the best part). You've got car chases, shootouts, and even some stealthy sneaking around. It's like a whole 'nother game in one!

Now, I know what you're thinking - "What about the open-world aspect?" Well, my young friends, Watch Dogs' Chicago is basically an open-world playground. You can explore to your heart's content, taking in the sights and sounds (or not - there are plenty of ways to get around without being seen).

So, there you have it! That's my take on Watch Dogs. If you're looking for a game that's all about fun, hacking, and high-octane action, then this is the game for you.

Gonna leave ya with some parting words from the Vandal critic - "It is a great surprise... [and] even though we've felt the team behind could have pushed harder to make it a better experience, it's a game fans of the genre will definitely enjoy."

Peace out, and happy gaming!
